clinical_study.official_title: Evaluating the Impact of an Emotion Regulation Intervention on Emotion Perception

collaborator.agency: Mind and Life Institute, Hadley, Massachusetts

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to assess the impact of a brief, emotion regulation intervention on the ability to perceive other people's emotions.

primary_outcome.measure: The ability to perceive negative and positive emotional expressions, as measured by a behavioral computer-based assessment
primary_outcome.time_frame: Laboratory assessment, up to one week
primary_outcome.description: Emotion perception is measured by a computer-based behavioral assessment during the laboratory session. Scores for negative emotional expressions and positive emotional expressions range from 0-30, with higher scores indicating greater emotion perception accuracy.

primary_outcome.measure: Changes in emotion perception, as measured by a phone-based behavioral assessment
primary_outcome.description: Perception of positive emotional expressions and negative emotional expressions are measured by a behavioral phone-based assessment, delivered multiple times over one week via mobile phones. Scores for negative emotional expressions and positive emotional expressions range from 0-21, with higher scores indicating greater emotion perception accuracy.

secondary_outcome.measure: Emotional distress, as measured by Subjective Units of Distress (SUDS)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Laboratory assessment, up to one week
secondary_outcome.description: Scores are measured on a 10-point Likert self-report scale of Subjective Units of Distress (SUDS), ranging from 0-9 with higher scores indicating higher emotional distress (worse outcome).

other_outcome.measure: Changes in emotional arousal, as measured by skin conductance response (SCR)
other_outcome.time_frame: Laboratory assessment, up to one week
other_outcome.description: Changes in emotional arousal are measured physiologically with electrodermal activity. Skin conductance response measures phasic changes in electrical conductivity of skin, with a minimum threshold of 0.01Î¼S with higher values indicating greater changes in emotional arousal.

arm_group.description: Participants receive training in a mindful breathing skill to regulate their emotional distress during a stressor task. They will then receive one week of reminders to use this skill, delivered through their mobile phones.

Participants receive an exposure/habituation intervention to regulate their emotional distress during a stressor task. They will then receive one week of reminders, delivered through their mobile phones.

Participants complete the stressor task with no emotion regulation training. Similar to the other conditions, they will then receive one week of reminders, delivered through their mobile phones to test for placebo effects.

intervention.description: Training in a mindful breathing skill that reduces emotional distress
An exposure procedure that reduces emotional distress through habituation
